review_title: SXU is an awful place to work
pros: There is only one pro: Free Tuition for employees, spouse, and children.  It’s a good place to work if you are a new young employee with no experience.
cons:
If you are a long-time loyal employee you are intimidated into taking on work above your pay grade without compensation. If you want to keep your job just be quiet and do what you’re told regardless of the inequity.  

Don’t question your boss. If you are being paid less than coworker for same job, don’t ask your boss to be paid the same.  Just be quiet so that you can keep your job. 

New employees with less experience will be paid more and you will be required to train them without compensation. Don’t complain about it.  Just be quiet and do it so you can keep your job. 

Don’t expect to be treated with respect or valued. 

Just be quiet and don’t talk to anyone to give yourself time to get out of there.  

Don’t talk to coworkers. Just lay low and keep to yourself. Don’t ask questions, just go along with what you’re told to do until you can get another job.

review_title: New Leadership was a needed change

review_title: Low pay, lack of flexibility, and a broken culture
pros: Students are awesome! There's also the ability to get involved in different areas, develop new programs, and push for things that you are passionate about. Much of the staff is great to work with.
cons: It's time for new leadership. The president is visibly absent and seems out of touch with the campus community. Too much damage has been done and I don't know if we can move past it. Feuds between administration and faculty have made the environment so unpleasant work in. Feels like a "divide and conquer" situation instead of a culture of collaboration. Many people feel silenced out of fear of retribution or termination if you voice any disagreement. The head of HR is absolutely awful! He inserts his own personal, and often snarky comments, he belittles and infantilizes employees, and creates an emotionally unsafe environment. The opposite of what HR should be doing. There's also a lack of upward mobility and the pay for many positions is not livable. SXU needs to do better!
